title: (rant please ignore) I'm so mad right now
body:
**Just kinda mad and I wanna vent a bit, but dunno where and how so I chose the forum. Forgive me.**

As Pantheon, I went 8/0/2 right off the bat, killed the living hell out of my lane (mid) and the other (bot), I also killed the enemy jungler occasionally, and other things.

So far so good.

And my team started dying, they started rushing into the middle of enemy team solo, they started doing god knows what and they just kept dying.

What's infuriating was that for some reason, the enemy MF, who has been dying throughout the game, manages to team-wipe us in a team-fight by pressing R only and all of us instantly died. When I checked my death-cam, guess what, I was stuck by 1 wave of it, and it gave me 1010 damage upfront!

Eventually we lost because we were never really fighting together more than a group of 3 as there was always another couple on death timer while the still living ones would charge and suicide for some reasons and cycle repeats until our nexus via a overwhelming 5-man "for" surrender vote. In the end-game chat I mentioned, though in a frustrated but civil tone how it's frustrating to lose a game after going 8/0/2 and their response was "git gud".

Clearly an intelligent remark.

I go on mentioning that MF's ulti is situationally broken because I was downed without as much as blinking and the thing's range is insane of its potential damage and the fact there is 0 telegraph at all, guess what they said? "Get better at dodging, you just suck". And they leave the end-game chat the **instant** after posting that shit.

FARK YOU, seriously.

.........................

It can't be my fault to assume some semblance of civility and grace from fellow players, can't it? Oh well. Shit happens.

If Panth is utterly useless after a certain period of time in the game (yeah he is), then it's not like I didn't create a window for my team to scale by riding on top of my "heads-up" and the advantages disparity between ourselves and them due to me killing them a bunch of times.

I may not have been perfect, since if possible I should've given maybe a couple kills to others to distribute the gold better, but I don't think I "did badly" tbh.

But idk.

True.

> It can't be my fault to assume some semblance of civility and grace from fellow players, can't it?

Hardly. "Not being an asshole" shouldn't be the goal, it should be the norm. Unfortunately, not many people see it that way, especially when you throw in a social barrier like the internet where faces, names (and in this case voices) are obscured. Many people struggle enough with perceiving others as real people with thoughts and feelings an different perspectives on things, but when key indicators of such are obscured it becomes even harder.

Of course there still needs to be a lack of understanding of consequences beyond the immediate and direct (and sometimes that too) but a lot of people seem to have that in spades. The result is people treating other people how they would an inanimate object or undefined construct rather than what they are, i.e other people.

That is ofc a massive generalisation, and doesn't apply to nearly as many people as it feels like, and there are always the exceptions that are legitimately just a-holes irl, but your rant is perfectly justified either way.

Yeah you're right. I definitely see your point.

But yeah, really I mean, I actually don't mind being disagreed, being told that I suck at the game, or other random things, as there are really nothing psrticularly wrong or distracting with them tbh (unless harassment which would be another matter entirely). It's really the fact I lost the game after doing so well initially, and being thrown the cold water after the match, that the big disappointment combined with that quip that tipped me over the edge and got me, as it was like being punched in the D twice in a row.

But yeah, still, I should be more in tune with myself rather than getting railed up like this over some quibble, I haven't improved at all in this respect it would seem lol. 

Other than them needing to be a bit more graceful, I also need to get tougher skins. Thx for the reply though, definitely appreciate it.

Eh nobody's perfect. Everyone gets frustrated every now and again, and your scenario is definitely tuned pretty well to make someone so.

i think the biggest thing is recognising the behaviour, cause if you don't see it you can't do anything to improve it, which obviously isn't a problem for you. It's not like you did anything wrong or retaliated in a toxic manner. Sure it'd be great if we could be immune to frustration, but the important thing is less what you're feeling and more what you do about it.

Everyone has a right to be angry about one thing or another, but as soon as you start using that anger as an excuse to hurt people or break shit it becomes a problem. Doesn't really help your cause any either.

Idk, maybe she critted in her ulti, or maybe it's something else. Maybe they had buffs (I think they did end up netting Baron if I recall correctly). Maybe it's just random a glitch on the kill-feed. Or maybe I thought I was only hit by the wave once even though I actually got hit more than that due to say an error on my visual. Etc.

Still, I do know what I read, 1010 damage from her ulti on the kill-feed, which was written as the only source of damage from her in that fight. Though I don't have screenshot, and I doubt you'll believe it purely based on anecdotal evidence given your stance, however I'm just saying that I wasn't lying about the number I saw. I mean really, everything could be back-traced these days, nor is my post addressed to anybody to begin with (I even tell you that it's just a rant and everybody should avoid in the title); and even just logically, there are not much incentive to lie over a number due to how easily they could be disproven.

And when I said "most infuriating", I wasn't stating "fking OP", I merely stated so as a "Oh what really?" I only brought it up in the game to the enemy team by basing it off the facts that I saw "1010" from a single ulti and from a mostly un-fed ADC (at the time) in my kill feed, that I didn't seem to be hit by it much from my perspective at the time, and that the damage is probably too good for an ability that does have a huge range and doesn't have a telegraph. And even then I remained relatively civil and only called it "situationally broken" because I at least knew it must have been a combination of certain factors that somehow drove the number that high, even though I don't know which are the said factors (as I don't play MF). You could point out some stated details if they don't add up and all that, and clarifications/corrects are welcomed, but flat out calling another a liar just because there's something that doesn't seem to match up is needlessly aggressive. 

The main focus of the rant was simply about losing the game from a massive lead I worked for, feeling bad about it, and then being poured cold water by the enemy team, which caused me to lose my cool for a whatever reason (refer to the talk I had with Seras Dragon). And it's really just that.

If you're going to make a counter-argument of some sort, at least don't use some cheap tactics like ad-hominem. There is no issue in correcting others, but calling others "liars" outright because there might be some error in the person's descriptions, without considering the possibility of that they may be unaware of the said mistakes due to offsets by human errors or that they were being truthful but the events recalled weren't the full picture and all that, is not cool.
